metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3462 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
Incorrect sanitation of the 302 redirect field in HTTP transport method ofapt versions 1.4.8 and earlier can lead to content injection by a MITMattacker, potentially leading to remote code execution on the targetmachine.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.0.1ubuntu2.19
apt-transport-https - 1.0.1ubuntu2.19
apt-utils - 1.0.1ubuntu2.19
libapt-inst1.5 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.19
libapt-pkg4.12 - 1.0.1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1ubuntu2.19').
